author: jogada10
title: √Årbitro de Fluminense x S√£o Paulo tem pena ampliada pelo STJD
text: √Årbitro de Fluminense x S√£o Paulo tem pena ampliada pelo STJD Pleno dobra puni√ß√£o de Paulo Cesar Zanovelli da Silva (Fifa-MG) ap√≥s erro no duelo de Tricolores, no Maracan√£, em setembro Por seis votos a um, o √°rbitro Paulo C√©sar Zanovelli teve sua suspens√£o, anteriormente definida em 15 dias, aumentada para 30 dias, ap√≥s julgamento do Pleno do Superior Tribunal de Justi√ßa Desportiva (STJD) na tarde desta quinta-feira (24). O caso diz respeito √† partida [Fluminense](https://www.terra.com.br/esportes/fluminense/) e S√£o Paulo (vencida pelo Flu por 2 a 0), pela 25¬™ rodada do Brasileir√£o, e √† decis√£o tomada pelo √°rbitro de dar vantagem ao lance de uma falta e n√£o marcar toque de m√£o de um atleta do Tricolor carioca no lance do primeiro gol. A suspens√£o inicial ocorrera em 3 de outubro, quando o STJD julgou a poss√≠vel anula√ß√£o da partida a pedido do S√£o Paulo por suposto erro de direito por parte do √°rbitro. Uma semana depois, no dia 10, por√©m, Zanovelli conseguiu efeito suspensivo, que o liberava para apitar em todo o territ√≥rio nacional. Dessa forma, foi ele o respons√°vel por apitar [Botafogo](https://www.terra.com.br/esportes/botafogo/)-SP 0x1 Ituano, na √∫ltima quarta-feira (23), pela S√©rie B do Brasileir√£o. Agora, ele voltar√° a cumprir suspens√£o, agora ampliada para 30 dias. O erro No jogo entre Fluminense e S√£o Paulo, Zanovelli causou confus√£o ao n√£o reparar que o zagueiro Thiago Silva, da equipe carioca, botara a m√£o na bola com o jogo em andamento. O defensor, ignorando o sinal de vantagem do √°rbitro (que estava de costas), parou a bola com a m√£o para poder cobrar falta a favor do Fluminense no lance que originou o primeiro gol da partida, cometendo, assim, uma nova falta. O VAR, como ocorre em todos os gols, analisou o lance e sugeriu a ida de Zanovelli ao monitor para rever o mesmo. O √°rbitro da Fifa, por√©m, se contradiz no contato com a cabine do √°rbitro de v√≠deo. "Eu ia dar a vantagem, o jogador (Thiago Silva) para e bate a falta. Eu dei sinal de falta (NR: ele d√° sinal de vantagem, mas n√£o apita). Vamos seguir. Eu dei a vantagem, eu segui. √â gol legal, t√°, Igor (Junio Benevenuto, o VAR)?", concluiu. Siga nosso conte√∫do nas redes sociais: Bluesky, Threads, Twitter, Instagram e Facebook.

author: Riley Conlon
title: Auburn man shot to death by police officer after 'suspicious incident' in Opelika
text: Auburn man shot to death by police officer after 'suspicious incident' in Opelika Advertisement Auburn man shot to death by police officer after 'suspicious incident' in Opelika The Alabama Law Enforcement Agency is investigating after an Opelika police officer shot and killed a man last weekend.Just after 3 a.m. Sunday, an officer responded to a call regarding a "suspicious incident" in the 1800 Block of Century Boulevard, according to ALEA.Once on scene, the officer encountered 26-year-old Tice Daequan Cobb of Auburn, who was reportedly armed.>> FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL: Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | YouTube An altercation occurred between the two and Cobb was subsequently shot by the officer and pronounced dead at the scene.Further details are unavailable at this time as ALEA continues its investigation.Stay updated on the latest stories with the WVTM 13 app. You can download it here. OPELIKA, Ala. ‚Äî >> FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL: Stay updated on the latest stories with the WVTM 13 app. You can download it The Alabama Law Enforcement Agency is investigating after an Opelika police officer shot and killed a man last weekend. Just after 3 a.m. Sunday, an officer responded to a call regarding a "suspicious incident" in the 1800 Block of Century Boulevard, according to ALEA. Advertisement Once on scene, the officer encountered 26-year-old Tice Daequan Cobb of Auburn, who was reportedly armed. >> FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL: [Instagram ](https://www.instagram.com/wvtm13/)| [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@WVTM13) An altercation occurred between the two and Cobb was subsequently shot by the officer and pronounced dead at the scene. Further details are unavailable at this time as ALEA continues its investigation. Stay updated on the latest stories with the WVTM 13 app. You can download it [here](https://www.wvtm13.com/article/get-wvtm-13-on-the-go-download/44045536).

author: Business Wire
title: Life Is Chill Expands Line of THC Soft Gels with New Live Resin THC Capsules, A First Of Its Kind for the Arizona Market | dailytimesleader.com | Serving West Point & Clay County Since 1867
text:
The new plant-based soft gel will launch on Friday, January 19, providing Arizona consumers with a unique and innovative capsule option.
Ally Biotech, dba Life Is Chill, a science-based provider of leading-edge bioactive delivery solutions for cannabinoids, today announces the launch of its live resin soft-gel capsules, ResinTime, under its Life Is Chill product line. The initial offering to the market is vegan-friendly, a new innovative soft gel based on a tapioca-starch and sugar-free product that addresses some of the dietary needs of consumers. The launch of live resin capsules marks a new era for soft gels in the Arizona market and will meet the increasing demand for products made from fresh-frozen cannabis.
‚ÄúCapsules are an increasingly popular choice for those seeking a smoke-free and sugar-free product, but the common practice of using gelatin in pills makes them inaccessible to people who prefer plant-based products or people that have allergies to bovine gelatin,‚Äù said Francis Baczek, President at Life Is Chill. ‚ÄúOur newest addition to the Chill Pill product line solves this problem with the additional benefit of high-quality live resin.‚Äù
The ResinTime soft gels will officially launch on January 19th, 2024, at The Superior Dispensary in Phoenix. The vegan-friendly ResinTime is the company's newest addition to its current portfolio of easy-to-swallow THC soft-gel capsules, which includes six other variations: Day Caps, Night Caps, Anytime Caps, Anytime Hybrid+, Extreme Caps, and THCa Caps.
‚ÄúWe are honored to kick off the launch of these live resin soft gels, a first of its kind in the Arizona market,‚Äù said Steve Shapiro, founder and CEO of The Superior Dispensary. ‚ÄúAs a vegan, I‚Äôm excited to have a vegan-friendly product available for consumers. These capsules will provide another great option for customers seeking new ways to consume live resin-based products in an easily digestible way.‚Äù
The award-winning soft gel brand is available in dozens of dispensaries across the state and has cemented itself as an Arizona staple for almost a decade. With the global cannabis capsule market expected to reach $108.14 billion by 2029, according to Data Bridge Market Research, and at least 6% of the American population identifying as either vegetarian or vegan, this new launch will meet the growing demand for dietary-friendly live resin products and provide an inhalation-free and sugar-free method of consumption for Arizona cannabis users.
The new product launch follows Ally Biotech‚Äôs acquisition of the Chill Pill line in the spring of 2023. It continues the company‚Äôs plan to expand its product line and establish itself as a market leader in the soft gel category. For more information about the Chill Pill, visit Lifeischill.com.
About Life Is Chill:
The Arizona-based Life Is Chill brand is an expansive line of easy-to-swallow THC soft gels for the cannabis industry. Formulated using hemp seed oil, Chill Pills are sugar-free, easy to absorb and metabolize, and come in various strengths and strains, with effects ranging from highly responsive to highly relaxed. Life Is Chill is owned and operated by Ally Biotech, a company committed to harnessing the power of science to create innovative THC products. For more information, visit Lifeischill.com .
About Ally Biotech:
Headquartered in Payson, Arizona, Ally Biotech manufactures highly bioavailable products. The company‚Äôs Lipofusion¬Æ delivery technology combines nanotechnology and liposomal science to speed product differentiation and innovation. The company‚Äôs products undergo rigorous testing for purity, potency, safety, and efficacy at third-party laboratories. For more information, visit AllyBiotech.com . For more information about the Life Is Chill brand, please visit Lifeischill.com.

author: Jay Peters
title: iFixit now sells official Xbox parts
text:
iFixit now sells genuine Xbox parts you can use to repair your Xbox Series X or S and offers official guides to help with fixes. You can browse what‚Äôs available from iFixit‚Äôs Microsoft Repair Hub .
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre excited to be working with Microsoft to keep Xboxes running longer and out of the waste heap,‚Äù Elizabeth Chamberlain, iFixit‚Äôs director of sustainability, says in a statement to The Verge . ‚ÄúWe now offer official Microsoft parts and step-by-step repair guides for Xbox Series S and Series X, including both the all-digital and disk drive editions.‚Äù
iFixit‚Äôs Microsoft Repair Hub also features iFixit‚Äôs parts for repairing Microsoft Surface devices, which it started selling in 2023 . ‚ÄúSince we launched our Surface parts collaboration with Microsoft last year, we‚Äôve been helping our customers repair their own Microsoft laptops and tablets ‚Äî and it‚Äôs awesome to be able to offer Xbox owners the same opportunity,‚Äù Chamberlain says.
Related iFixit now sells Microsoft Surface parts for repair iFixit will sell nearly every part of the Steam Deck ‚Äî including the entire motherboard Microsoft isn‚Äôt the only gaming company that iFixit has partnered with; iFixit sells nearly every part of the Steam Deck and offers a bunch of repair guides for Valve‚Äôs handheld PC , too. Microsoft itself offers first-party parts for the standard and Elite Series 2 Xbox controllers.
iFixit also offers genuine repair parts for Google‚Äôs Pixel phones and the Pixel Tablet . The company had sold genuine parts from Samsung, but that partnership ended earlier this year .

author: @Our Correspondent
title: Three jailed for encounter with police, unlicensed weapons
text: An anti-terrorism court has awarded a collective sentence of 26 years imprisonment to three men in cases pertaining to an encounter with police and possession of illicit arms. Azam Ali, Ghulam Shabbir, and Hamid Ali were found guilty of firing on police with intent to kill, injuring a cop and creating sense of fear within the jurisdiction of the Gulshan-e-Iqbal police station in May last year. The ATC-II judge, who announced his order after recording evidence and final arguments from both defence and prosecution sides, ruled that the prosecution successfully proved its charges against the accused beyond any shadow of doubt. He also ordered the convicts to pay a collective fine of Rs15,000 each or undergo additional one-year imprisonment. They were further told to jointly pay Rs2.2 million as compensation to Constable Syed Atif Shah. ‚ÄúThe present accused had used serious violence by firing on the police party and deterred them in the performance of official duty, and as a result, one police official received serious injury,‚Äù the judge noted. ‚ÄúFurthermore, the same incident had occurred at a public place. Hence, the present act of accused persons had created sense of fear, panic, terror and insecurity among the people of the area as well as in the society.‚Äù The convicts have been remanded back to prison with conviction warrants to serve out the sentences that shall concurrently. State prosecutor Parwez Ghumro contended that the three accused opened fire on a police party with intention to kill on University Road, on May 16, 2023, as a result of which Constable Atif Shah suffered firearm injury. Three 30-bore pistols were seized from the possession of the accused, he added. Sindh Inspector General of Police Riffat Mukhtar Raja has assigned an additional 625 personnel to the Karachi police... The Election Commission of Pakistan‚Äôs monitoring officer on election campaigns imposed a fine of Rs50,000 on the...

author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: Ukraine, US bombs Russia. Putin sets date to liberate Kursk
text:
Ukraine Continues Attack on Russia‚Äôs Kursk Region, Uses American Bombs Meanwhile, Vladimir Putin outlines the road map to reconquer the territory invaded by Kiev and also sets a deadline.
The offensive of the Ukrainian armed forces remains in the spotlight in the war that has been going on for more than 900 days. The operation is aimed at ending the war ‚Äúon the terms of an independent Ukraine,‚Äù says Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, stressing that to end the war it is necessary to create as many problems as possible for the Russian state on its territory.
‚ÄúWe all need to understand that in order to expel the occupier from our land, we need to create as many problems as possible for the Russian state on its territory. This is the heroic work of our soldiers. And this heroic work is more accurate, longer-range and more effective,‚Äù he added. The Ukrainian Air Force reported that it used American high-precision bombs, model GBU-39, to strike Russian military targets in the Kursk region. ‚ÄúThe United States could stop Ukraine‚Äôs actions with a snap of its fingers,‚Äù Anatoly Antonov, Russian ambassador to Washington, said at the same time.
Putin‚Äôs Strategy Putin also spoke, denouncing the Ukrainian attempt to ‚Äústrike a nuclear power plant. The International Atomic Energy Agency was informed about it and promised to send specialists to assess the situation. I hope that in the end they will do this,‚Äù the Russian president said, quoted by the Tass agency.
Putin‚Äôs conduct has been in the spotlight since the beginning of the Ukrainian offensive. Analysts from the Institute for the study of war (ISW), an American think tank that monitors the conflict, refer to a communication campaign launched by the Kremlin: the aim would be to make the limited presence of Ukrainian soldiers on Russian territory ‚Äòacceptable‚Äô to public opinion.
This would be, as Russian government sources confirmed to the independent outlet Meduza, a sort of ‚Äòunforeseen event‚Äô which must not obscure the priority: the Russian campaign in Donetsk, marked by advances by Moscow‚Äôs forces in recent days and destined to end with the ‚Äòinevitable‚Äô defeat of Kiev.
Putin has no intention of formalizing the emergency in the Kursk region, and for this reason the elections for the new governor, scheduled for September, remain on the calendar. The information collected by Meduza paints a wait-and-see picture from Moscow: all the Russian sources consulted expect the hostilities in Kursk to last for months, with the high probability that the Kremlin will continue to favor operations in Donetsk and will not order the redeployment of troops on its territory.
Kremlin Wants to Liberate Kursk by October 1 The Ukrainian newspaper RBC painted a different picture: Putin has asked to liberate Kursk by October 1st and the objective must be achieved without the help of units currently deployed in the areas of Pokrovsk and Toretsk, in eastern Ukraine. Kiev‚Äôs armed forces entered Russia on August 6th. Even if the deadline set by Putin were to be respected, the Kremlin would have to justify the presence of the invaders on national soil for about 2 months.
The president reportedly considered a new mobilization to counter the enemy‚Äôs advance but the hypothesis was shelved due to the repercussions that such a measure would have on the economy. The possibility of continuing to use conscripts, draftees, in the Kursk region remains in the background. Putin, at the beginning of the war, announced that conscripts would not be used on the front line. However, about 2 weeks ago, very young conscripts found themselves having to fight ‚Äì with terrible results ‚Äì the Ukrainian incursion.
Read also
#Ukraine #bombs #Russia #Putin #sets #date #liberate #Kursk

author: John Binder
title: Biden Giving Sanctuary NYC Over $100 Million in Aid for Migrants
text: President Joe Biden will send New York City, a sanctuary jurisdiction, more than $100 million in aid for migrants ‚Äî including footing the bill for their luxury hotel stays. Last year, House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-NY) and Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) announced that American taxpayers would be forced to subsidize mass migration in New York City to the sum of more than $100 million. The Biden administration has already sent New York City millions to cover costs associated with migrants, including their housing, food, and social services. Much of the funding had been held up with paperwork. The New York Daily News, though, reports that the taxpayer money is finally set to be trickled down to migrants living in the Big Apple: The aid ‚Äî which has sat untouched since Congress first allocated it last summer ‚Äî is at long last being authorized for disbursement to the city after Adams‚Äô administration provided the feds last Friday with required budgetary documentation as well as a waiver asking the feds to relax a cap on how much of the money can be used on hotel costs, said Schumer‚Äôs office. [Emphasis added] ‚Ä¶ Under existing rules, only 10% of the total aid earmarked for the city can be used to cover costs related to housing migrants in hotels. FEMA is expected to bump that figure up to 15% in response to the Adams administration‚Äôs waiver request, clearing the way for the city to receive the full pot of aid, according to Schumer‚Äôs team. [Emphasis added] New York City Mayor Eric Adams (D) is currently suing several Texas-based charter bus companies for dropping off migrants in the sanctuary city without covering the costs of caring for or housing them. According to Adams, from April 2022 through December 2023, New Yorkers have been forced to spend $3.5 billion housing, feeding, and clothing nearly 200,000 migrants released into the U.S. interior by the Biden administration. John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Email him at jbinder@breitbart.com. Follow him on Twitter here .

author: @okdiario
title: Sumar califica de "inaceptable" el nombramiento de la nueva directora del Instituto de la Mujer
text: Sumar califica de ¬´inaceptable¬ª el nombramiento de la nueva directora del Instituto de la Mujer ¬´El nombramiento del Ministerio de Igualdad es inaceptable. La direcci√≥n del Instituto de las Mujeres no puede estar en manos de quien menosprecia e insulta a las mujeres y las personas LGTBI¬ª. As√≠, de contundente se ha mostrado Sumar, partido de la vicepresidenta del Gobierno, [Yolanda D√≠az](https://okdiario.com/espana/sumar-podemos-acuerdan-ir-juntos-elecciones-galicia-12132383), al calificar de ¬´inaceptable¬ª el nombramiento de Isabel Garc√≠a como directora del Instituto de la Mujer, en referencia a las declaraciones de Garc√≠a de que ¬´las mujeres trans no existen¬ª. Entre sus declaraciones que le han enfrentado a Podemos, se destaca adem√°s cuando se√±al√≥ que ¬´la teor√≠a queer avanza sin descanso con el √∫nico objetivo de perpetuar el heteropatriarcado y borrar a las mujeres de lo pol√≠tico¬ª. Por todo lo citado anteriormente, la aprobaci√≥n de Isabel Garc√≠a en su cargo este mi√©rcoles en el Consejo de Ministros a propuesta de la ministra de Igualdad, [Ana Redondo](https://okdiario.com/espana/ana-redondo-ministra-igualdad-tiene-apartamento-espacio-natural-protegido-montana-palentina-12078192), representa golpe de tim√≥n en el Ministerio de Igualdad, debido a que Garc√≠a se ha pronunciado en contra de la autodeterminaci√≥n de g√©nero y ha sido cr√≠tica con las pol√≠ticas de la anterior ministra de Igualdad, Irene Montero, como se ha citado anteriormente. ¬´Es especialmente grave en un momento en el que vemos retroceder los derechos del colectivo LGTBI en la Comunidad de Madrid y amenazados en otras comunidades gobernadas por la alianza de la derecha y extrema derecha¬ª, se ha indicado desde Sumar sobre la decisi√≥n de la ministra de Igualdad, Ana Redondo Garc√≠a, del nombramiento de la nueva directora del Instituto de la Mujer, que pone de manifiesto las [fisuras que existen entre el PSOE y Sumar](https://okdiario.com/madrid/montero-encara-unas-feministas-que-critican-ley-trans-cierre-campana-10985339). El nombramiento del Ministerio de Igualdad es inaceptable. La direcci√≥n del Instituto de las Mujeres no puede estar en manos de quien menosprecia e insulta a las mujeres y las personas LGTBI. La libertad es de todas, todos y todes, o no es de nadie. ‚Äî Sumar (@sumar) [December 28, 2023] As√≠, Garc√≠a sustituye a Ana Varela, nombrada por la ex ministra [Irene Montero](https://okdiario.com/espana/montero-dice-que-mujeres-trans-tienen-mas-dificultad-economica-adquirir-productos-menstruales-10743977) en sustituci√≥n de Antonia Morillas, tras presentarse como alcaldesa en M√°laga en las elecciones del pasado 28 de mayo. Una decisi√≥n que ha provocado una gran reacci√≥n en redes sociales en pol√≠ticos y votantes de Sumar y Podemos. La portavoz del partido de Yolanda D√≠az en materia de feminismo, igualdad y derechos y libertades LGTBI, Elizabeth Duval, ha tildado de ¬´vergonzoso¬ª el citado nombramiento de Isabel Garc√≠a al frente del Instituto de las Mujeres. Es una verg√ºenza la designaci√≥n desde el Ministerio de Igualdad de Isabel Garc√≠a como directora del Instituto de las Mujeres, inasumible que alguien con esa responsabilidad en las pol√≠ticas p√∫blicas de igualdad, mantenga discursos coincidentes con la ultraderecha hac√≠a una de las‚Ä¶ [https://t.co/eTaG54hKPd] [pic.twitter.com/ejmzUyzxWY] ‚Äî üîªMar Cambroll√© üè≥Ô∏è‚ößÔ∏è Hay Ley Trans (@CambrolleMar) [December 28, 2023] ¬´Las mujeres trans no existen¬ª A Isabel Garc√≠a, la nueva directora del Instituto de las Mujeres, hay que explicarle que colectivo LGTBI y Feminismo van de la mano. Un Gobierno progresista no puede poner al frente de una instituci√≥n a una persona tr√°nsfoba. Cuesti√≥n de DDHH‚Ä¶ [pic.twitter.com/mxGLawmxOe] ‚Äî Marc Cebri√°n (@MarcCebrians) [December 28, 2023] ¬´Este nombramiento del Ministerio de Igualdad es vergonzoso y env√≠a un mensaje lamentable. El Instituto de las Mujeres no puede estar dirigido por alguien que sostiene la conspiraci√≥n del borrado de las mujeres y critica la dictadura queer¬ª, ha indicado, que forma parte de la direcci√≥n provisional de Sumar hasta la celebraci√≥n de su asamblea. La ex ministra de Igualdad, Irene Montero, tambi√©n se ha unido a las cr√≠ticas a Isabel Garc√≠a.
